field.name: description
field.value:
Support NHibernate's optimistic-lock wherever possible. The class hierarchies have been examined to ensure that the patch does not add support to an attribute where that support is not actually available in NHibernate.
http://github.com/patearl/Castle.ActiveRecord/commit/517cb1b792bb5c660688ef551277848eb04e3d5c

comment.author: patearl
comment.text: Added unit tests and fixed a missed case in this commit: http://github.com/patearl/Castle.ActiveRecord/commit/048e062918c2d8757c4264792369d680c2275d7f

comment.author: patearl
comment.text:
Even with the unit tests, there was a bug. I forgot to add the extra format string elements. I also noticed there was at least one other case (unrelated to my patch) where the same bug was present. I have had problems with that format string before, so I decided to eliminate it entirely to prevent the possibility of future bugs. I've consolidated all changes (via rebase, yes, I know, bad) into the the following commit:
http://github.com/patearl/Castle.ActiveRecord/commit/9cd04267c10a0e984a638b392b11c0559119d94e
